Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails and prioritize tasks for the week, focusing on the EHR vendor consultation.
Research the EHR vendor's documentation and support portal to familiarize myself with recent updates and potential compatibility issues. Website Browsing: Stack Overflow for EHR integration tips.

Draft an email to @ehrv-1 (EHR Vendor Liaison) outlining the updates and modifications needed for EHR collection and seasonal influenza trend analysis, requesting a meeting to discuss feasibility. @PEOPLE: ehrv-1; Topic: EHR Update Feasibility Meeting Request
Continue researching EHR API documentation related to data extraction for influenza trends. Website Browsing: HL7 standards documentation.
Confirm meeting time with @ehrv-1 for later in the week. If no response, follow up with a phone call.
Lunch break. Check tech news on Reddit.
Prepare a preliminary list of questions for the EHR vendor regarding cost estimates, development timelines, and potential challenges.

Consult with @dba-1 (Database Administrator) to discuss database capacity and scalability requirements for the influx of EHR data related to influenza trends. @PEOPLE: dba-1; Topic: Database Scalability for EHR Data
Document the expected data flow from the EHR system to the database, identifying potential bottlenecks and security considerations.
Review notes and finalize the agenda for the meeting with the EHR vendor. Begin drafting a document outlining the project's technical specifications.
Check emails one last time. Plan for tomorrow's activities.
